comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
I wonder if this is Mrs Evans? - SMH 11/10/1930 p.7 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16721709
" ... .... Mrs E.R.G.R. Evans wore a frock of sand-coloured chiffon, covered with a satin coat of the same tone with a deep collar of beige fox. Her hat was of sand-coloured felt. ... .... "
!!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Great research and thanks for the article! It is likely to be her because we've just uploaded another photograph and identified the woman in the centre to be Madame Teppema, who is wearing a black suit, white blouse, baku hat and holding a bouquet of carnations. How exciting! bit.ly/KY5HZF
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
